item.name: 1000 und ein Schatz
item.comment: I guess it wouldn't be so bad for kids. But for adults it's just way too easy. Which also makes me doubt this would work as a family game without the adults heavily throwing the game.

item.name: Among the Stars
item.wishlistcomment:
Interesting cross between 7 Wonders and Alhambra, but has lots of English text. Didn't knock my socks off either but looks great!
@Secret Santa: See my profile.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: One of our favorite games back home. Relaxed game play, interesting trading and nice, silly artwork.

item.name: Brändi Dog
item.comment: One of our favorite games in most of my gaming groups. Much more meaningful than traditional Pachisi variants. Simple to learn but with interesting decisions and a nice team work aspect.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: Classic push-your-luck game. Short, fun and interesting game play.

item.name: Diamant
item.comment: Not my cup of tea. I otherwise like push-your-luck games but somehow this doesn't excite me all that much. Pretty well made. I'd play but would favor games like Can't Stop or Pickomino.

item.name: Dice Brewing
item.comment: Played it once in each constellation (2-4 players) and it seems to get more cutthroat with less players. So far I like it a lot.

item.name: Die Kutschfahrt zur Teufelsburg
item.comment: A bit to obvious with just 4 players. Probably much more fun with bigger groups.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: I enjoy playing the game but I'm just not drawn to it. Somehow I just can't find the enthusiasm to get it off the shelf.
item.conditiontext: Some German edition. Played about a handful of times only.

item.name: Dragonscroll
item.comment: My first Fragor game is shaping up to be quite the hit. While aside from the flaming tower of death the rest of the mechanics are very ordinary, they are well blended together. The rules are pretty light but the turns and their decisions are always interesting. There's no direct interaction but subtle opportunities for blocking or making things a bit harder for your opponents. And the idea that the winner can tell his story at the end is a very nice touch.

item.name: Elfenland
item.comment: Nice game but a surprisingly long rulebook for such a short game.

item.name: The Enigma of Leonardo: Quintis Fontis
Firefly: Das Spiel
item.comment: Very well received among my group, despite them not even knowing the show. Great theme integration.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: Very well implemented theme. Less predictable than Pandemic but randomness is still very manageable. Great scaleability both in terms of difficulty/complexity as well as player numbers. Nice variety of roles.

item.name: Fleet
item.comment: Has the same build to profit from recurring actions mechanism as San Juan but does it with Auctions instead of Role Selection. Interesting light weight tactical game.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.wishlistcomment:
While it seems more complex than Gauntlet of Fools, it's available in German and has a proven track record.
@Secret Santa: See my profile.

item.name: Gauntlet of Fools
item.wishlistcomment:
Not entirely sure about replayability. I should probably wait for a German edition before purchasing. Feels quite thin and there does not seem to be a lot of versatility in the boasts. Galaxy Trucker is much more engaging.
@Secret Santa: See my profile.

item.name: Ginkgopolis
item.wishlistcomment: A bit fiddly and complex but was quite interesting to play.

item.name: GOSU
item.comment: Interesting but unless you really know those cards inside out and are very adept in handling their interactions the game just flows way too slowly for my taste.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: This is simply the most clever cooperative game I've ever seen. Simple to learn but always challenging, innovative gameplay, no downtime. This is the small package good things come in.

item.name: Hera and Zeus
item.comment: Much too complex rules for such a light game. Horrible luck. Will not play again.

item.name: Der Hobbit: Eine unerwartete Reise – Das Spiel zum Film
item.comment: I promised a friend to learn the game for her. Having seen "The Hobbit Part 1" I feared this would be the worst kind of shovelware. But I was positively surprised. It's nothing I'd buy for myself but it's a decent game. Certainly enjoyable enough for the kind of customer who buys a game because they saw the movie...

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: Doesn't seem to work well with few players but otherwise an enjoyable, light, fast game.
item.wishlistcomment:
I ended up skipping this one for a different dice game this year. But with it's fun theme and short duration it could still have a place alongside similar games.
@Secret Santa: See my profile.

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment: Deceptively simple game. Nice variety and hidden depths.

item.name: Lobo 77
item.comment: Not really a lot of choice in this game. But it plays fast, provides some good laughs and a healthy dose of delicious screwage. Player elimination is not much of an issue either.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: Fell pretty flat last time with 2 players.

item.name: Meltdown 2020
item.wishlistcomment: Interesting theme and challenging enough game play. But not sure if it's just the novelty or if this would have staying power...

item.name: Money Money
item.comment: Fun game with many push your luck elements. One of the best aspects is how it keeps everyone engaged all the time because everything almost always affects everyone.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: Once you had your couple of chuckles from the card texts and images you're left with random, tedious exercise almost completely devoid of challenge.

item.name: Der Natur auf der Spur
item.comment: A pretty good and nicely done family game. Not exactly my genre anymore but if you have kids and want them to learn a few things about nature this is a good game to get (consider it to be a 7.5 then).

item.name: Ostfriesisches Schafe-Schubsen
item.comment: Interesting enough bluffing game. Nice components but unfortunately there's way to little actual "Schafe-Schubsen" making a sizable chunk of the rules superfluous.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Interesting game but too long and thinky for most of my gaming groups. Has one of the best rulebooks I've ever seen.
item.conditiontext: Played once or twice. Some German edition.

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment: Just didn't click with me. Not having to shuffle is an advantage over Dominion but somehow it felt even more hollow than that.

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment: Very short and engaging social deduction game. Similar to Werewolves but without player elimination. A hit with players from very casual to quite serious.

item.name: The Resistance: Avalon
item.wishlistcomment: I already have the original Resistance. So while the new roles sound interesting I don't know how much diversity this one would add to my collection. Alternatively I could just try and get the "Merlin"/Assassin promo for the original.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
San Juan
item.comment: Shorter and less analytical sibling of Puerto Rico. A much better fit for my gaming groups.

item.name: Seasons
item.comment: Great game but runs much longer than advertised.

item.name: Skip-Bo
item.comment: Utterly uninteresting game play. No meaningful decisions. The cellulose that makes up this game would serve a more dignified purpose in the form of toilet paper...

item.name: Space Cadets
item.wishlistcomment:
Heard lots of good things. Interesting spin on the coop genre. Real time minigame cooperation with a space ship theme. Only a "2" because of the language.
If this ever comes out in German then I want to have its babies...

item.name: Stalag 17
item.comment: Essentially Rummy with a theme and some slight twists (for the better).

item.name: Star Realms
item.comment:
Play very casually or very deliberately.
Unless you're willing to invest AP-levels of attention and consideration into every move or have an incredibly high tolerance for frustration and/or randomness this game probably isn't for you.
Very interesting concept but this immense randomness means that you will do badly if you just try to play as you go.

item.name: Stargate Trading Card Game
item.conditiontext: I'd have to inventory the cards but I have at least two displays worth of cards plus several starter decks. I believe some deck/boosters are even unopened...

item.name: Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Phoenixelfen & Tundraorks
item.originalname: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs

item.name: Sunrise City
item.comment: 2015-10-01 Thursday 2015-10-02 Friday
item.wishlistcomment: Simple but clever game play. IT'S COMING OUT IN GERMAN!

item.name: Team Work Original
item.comment: Simply not my kind of game. I'd probably play it just for the challenge of building the sentences though...

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment: This game completely blows Dominion out of the water for me. Everything just feels richer. Turns are more interesting. Getting victory points is more fun and expanding your deck more intricate.

item.name: Tonga Island
item.comment: It's heavily reliant on good luck and an eidetic memory. Otherwise you can easily waste multiple turns while other players race ahead.

item.name: Tzolk'in: Der Maya-Kalender
item.comment: Very clever worker placement game. But it requires a lot of careful planning which I don't seem to be able to pull of as consistently as I'd like. This has put the game on the backburner recently. A shame because it's a well done game with very clear iconography.

item.name: Ubongo
item.comment: Fun and fast spatial speed puzzle in the line of Tetris or Tangram with a hint of strategy. Nice colorful components.

item.name: Uluru: Tumult am Ayers Rock
item.comment: Pretty challenging speed logic puzzle. Nice components and game play.

item.name: Wizard
item.comment: Great trick taking game. Having to announce your number of tricks and playing with different numbers of cards is a nice combination of more traditional games.

item.name: Yardmaster Express
item.comment: After a couple of plays the randomness of the game became more apparent. Still a nice, quick and simple game, though.
